sourceDesc.p: Researched and written by Christopher Morrison, March 2008

div.head: Summary
div.p: The United States recognized Namibia on March 21, 1990, when the U.S. Liaison Office at Windhoek was elevated to Embassy status with Roger A. McGuire as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim.

div.head: U.S. Recognition of Namibia’s Independence, 1990.
div.p: The United States recognized Namibia on March 21, 1990, when the U.S. Liaison Office at Windhoek was elevated to Embassy status with Roger A. McGuire as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim, upon Namibia’s attainment of independence on that date. Namibia previously had been under South African sovereignty.

div.head: Establishment of Diplomatic Relations and the American Embassy in Namibia, 1990.
div.p: Diplomatic relations were established on March 21, 1990, when the U.S. Liaison Office at Windhoek was elevated to Embassy status with Roger A. McGuire as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim.
